data.title: Fix msvc compile error
Ability to view invisible/hidden nodes in editor
data.body:
In the editor, i would appreciate the ability to view all invisible/hidden nodes (by "Invisible/Hidden", i mean visual nodes (Sprites, Meshes etc.) that have been hidden by their node properties) without actually affecting their node properties, thus making it easy to return to normal (Preferably from the edit tab in the toolbar).

EDIT: It would also be appreciated as a debug option to see the invisible/hidden nodes ingame

This would be handy in so many situations as having to manually set nodes to visible to edit them is kinda annoying when working with invisible nodes.

For instance in a game I am working on, i use invisible tiles with an x texture to form walls, having to constantly set these visible and invisible to edit them and ensure they do not show up ingame is a pain!

There are many other examples that come to mind where this would be useful, plus it's a seemingly very small addition so there should be few conflicts with other features

data.title: Depth of Field and Screen Space Reflections seem to use faulty masks
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux 4.8.11, godot  5cc63dee0f719139b263ac95027ce520843a9f5f (master)
NVIDIA Corporation GK106 [GeForce GTX 645 OEM] with nouveau driver, mesa 12.0.6

**Issue description:**
DOF and SSR seem to use a faulty mask, probably random memory.
The images show this behavior. In the first one, it looks like some other view of the aircraft is taken as mask for SSR, in the second image it looks like random memory garbage is used as mask.

**Images of the issue**
![SSR1](https://a.pomf.cat/gpeupp.png)
![SSR2](https://a.pomf.cat/rqkqae.png)

data.title: JSON not loading properly when prettified
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.1.2, Windows 10 64 bits

When I load a JSON file that was saved straight from Godot, I can load it fine.
Then for testing purpose, I wanted to edit it so I formatted it in Sublime Text (add indents and newlines so it looks more readable while still being valid), changed a value and saved it.
But Godot wasn't able to properly parse it. I get no error from the parser, but I can clearly see nothing was loaded in the dictionary. I even checked the JSON on a validator, and it's valid.

This one works:
```
{"version": 1}
```

This one doesn't:
```
{
  "version": 1
}
```

I tried to modify the file further and suddenly it worked.
Then I tried the same steps again and it didn't work again. :trollface:
So I copied the file straight from my project and managed to reproduce the error in a minimal example:

[JsonError.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/754602/JsonError.zip)

Just run the project, and you'll see it cannot get "version" from the file. Now change it to the minified file, and it works.

data.title: Godot 3 (editor) Ctrl+Up/Down (move  node) : focus goes to other control before moving node

are known and expected due to important refactoring work, so no need to report them for now. Thanks!
-->

Linux / Godot 3.0 ( 5cc63de )

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Editor : Focus on scene panel , Ctrl+Up/Down is use move up/down the node.
What happen is the focus goes to other control ( [+] , [node filter edit],  ...) before actually moving the node

**Steps to reproduce:**
In scene node hierachy, select to down child node , hit Ctrl+Up 4times before selected node actually move.

data.title: Korean input not properly work of TextEdit control on Android system. (+proposal)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Android - Tested on godot engine 2.1 branch recent.

**Issue description:**
In Android, when you type Korean characters, only the first consonant of the combined character will be entered and will be passed to next composition without the previous combination result applied. This is the result of receiving only the keystrokes without using the Android composition result. Only the callback of GodotTextInputWrapper will be called without any key events occurring during the compositing.

The final solution I think is that the input system itself is going to get the synthesis result of the OS, but I think the changes are going to be big, so I made it to work with small modifications first.

It clears the latest character including the characters in the composition, and replaces the last two(or one) character(s) with the characters provided by android TextView.OnEditorActionListener.

Following is the change I made.
Https://github.com/bugcaptor/godot/tree/fix-android-korean-input
That is based on master branch, but it can be merged on 2.1 branch because that file is same.

I have not tested this issue on iOS.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Type Korean characters in TextEdit on Android device.

data.title: Navigation using get_simple_path ignores partially open tiles ; "Condition !nm.linked is true"
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 / GD 2.1.2

**Issue description:**
Pathfinding using Navigation2D with a child TileMap whose tiles contain NavigationPolygons+Instances:
When invoking get_simple_path from the character (RigidBody2D > AnimationPlayer, 2 Sprite layers, CollisionShape2D, RayCast2D), any tiles which are not fully open are ignored. EG: In a build where stair tile NavPolygons did not include the leftmost and rightmost pixels (x of -8 or 8, leaving a 14 x 16 px NavPoly), function returned an empty path. Still happens with left/right and top/bottom bordered tiles, which use similar NavPolygons.
My project uses 16x16 map tiles and a 16x16 character. Shrinking the character sprites to below 14x14 did not solve the issue. 

Possibly related is this error, which appears in the log/terminal when the function fires:
"ERROR: Navigation2D::_navpoly_unlink: Condition ' !nm.linked ' is true.
At: scene\2d\navigation2d.cpp:147"

**Additional Information:**
Both the character sprites and tilemap are set to scale 2x2, though the issue still occurred at 1x1. Tiles also contain StaticBody2D and CollisionPolygon2D to prevent accidentally crossing over navigation boundaries and allow physics interactions. As get_simple_path produces some less-than-efficient paths when there are no obstacles, I'm using the RayCast to check for collisions to target and just setting the path to the target point if there aren't any. Oddly enough, since I'm creating the Nav and Collision polygons programmatically  in a tool script, they don't actually appear in the scene graph.)

![tilescene-editor](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6465542/22630391/358697e8-ebae-11e6-9c28-8e0ef6c79252.jpg)

data.title: AnimatedSprite signal frame_changed not firing
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
 OSX 10.11.6 Godot 2.1.2.stable.official

**Issue description:**
Maybe I am doing something wrong here. I can't seem to get an AnimatedSprite firing the frame_changed signal. I tried with using the signal connection on the Node panel and tried it programmatically. So please bear with me if I have a mistake in there.

**Steps to reproduce:**

Make an AnimatedSprite, add a script and try to connect to the frame_changed signal or use the Node panel on the animated sprite (also tried to connect to a different node to no avail)
In another more complex scenario, I get signaled only once with the same code. Is there some race condition? Or timer problem? In line 488 in animated_sprite the timer is reset? Just guessing ...

**Link to minimal example project:**

[Minimal_AnimatedSprite.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/753050/Minimal_AnimatedSprite.zip)

https://github.com/seichter/sandbox/tree/master/bugreports/godot-7730

data.title: Excessive capturing of touch events in web export causes zoom lock
data.body:
Web export consumes most input events.
For touch events, this is problematic on mobile devices: If a player zooms in on the page before the game starts, they can no longer use pinch gestures on the canvas to zoom back out after game has started. If the canvas is maximized, this makes it entirely impossible to zoom out.

data.title: Add CanvasItem property that would disable buffer cleaning on each _draw() call
data.body:
Currently Node or Control is cleaned on each _draw() call so you have to redraw whole thing.

When implementing custom drawing via _draw() it's not always optimal to redraw whole Node / Control. Disabling buffer cleaning in CanvasItem would allow to draw on top of prevous buffer and manually clean and redraw whole Node / Control when required.

data.title: Add dawing api to Texture class
data.body:
Feature request.
Basically all CanvasItem drawing methods but for Texture. Could be useful in procedural textures etc.

Alternativly method to dump CanvasItem content to texture so drawing could be done in CanvasItem.

data.title: Output tab doesn't close automatically after a run
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 8.1 - Godot v2.1.1 and 2.1.2:


**Issue description:**
In Godot 2.1, when you stopped a run, the Output tab was automatically closed. In Godot 2.1.1 and 2.1.2, it stays apparent, even when there were no errors. You have to close it yourself each time.


**Steps to reproduce:**
Load a project (with no error) and play it, the Output tab is shown.
Stop the execution, the output tab stays open, instead of being hidden as in v2.1


If this is a wanted behavior, it might be good to add an option here to disable it ;)
![output settings](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13215043/22622515/834f313c-eb3c-11e6-9bd5-b56cfb21ab1e.png)
Thank you all!

data.title: Camera smoothing makes sprites jitter
data.body:
Godot 2.1 official, linux x64

When camera eases out of movement with smoothing enabled (speed 5, camera drag) you can clearly see static sprites jitter. Issue does not affect tilemaps.

data.title: Built-in and custom shaders don't work on Android
data.body:
<!--
README: Incompatibilities and broken features in the current master branch / 3.0-alpha
are known and expected due to important refactoring work, so no need to report them for now. Thanks!
-->

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
ZTE Blade A512, Android 6.0 - 2.1.2 stable
Editor was run on Windows 10 Pro 64 bit

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Created two nodes, one with Lambert shading another one with Toon shading a camera node and a directional light node.
On Windows everything looks as expected: Two nodes with different shading.
On Android both nodes look the same (Lambert Shading).
Additionally, in any custom shaders the following outputs are ignored NORMALMAP, NORMALMAP_DEPTH. The LIGHT output seems to ignore LIGHT_DIFFUSE.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a Spatial root node .
Create a DirectionalLight node. Translate it to 0,0,8 (translation doesn't matter).
Create a Camera node. Translate it to 0,0,5 (translation doesn't matter, except to see the node).
Create a MeshInstance or TestCube. Create a new FixedMaterial and set Shader to Toon.
Run the project on Android and notice the missing effect.

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->:
https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B5tiIcef5MMVQnJBeXNsNEM4aXc

data.title: Fix parsing bug which causes range(variable) to crash the engine
data.body:
problem was a segmentation fault caused by trying to access Vector constants[0] which isn't there if op->arguments.size() is not bigger than one.

- the changed OR condition didn't make sense (always true), should be AND
- changes the "constant" variable to be false per default and gets set to true when there is actually something pushed to "constants"

Fixes #7662

data.title: Backport goodies for the code editors (2.1)
data.body:
Refactor duplicated code (from 0159e4f96918990ee7bc3e9616ba073e566ad6e4)
Add line length guideline to code editors (from d9c1729a8f1d3eceb259ef540b378b70beb55f24)
Allow turning off zero-padding for line numbers (from 00b3af246b03bc789a7edc45c11b000d7d63ad27)
(In 3.0 zero-padding is off by default, but for 2.1 I'm setting the default to be on because it's how it always worked.)
Fixed line lenght guideline drawing with color option (from @Paulb23's 6b42cd5fe637d6d0fe30fa397eca659d295ad956)

data.title: Ability to set compensated FOV in 3D
data.body:
Some games like [ET:Legacy](https://www.etlegacy.com/) feature the ability to set "compensated" FOV, that is, FOV that's set for a specific aspect ratio, and is automatically adjusted by the engine for wider or narrower aspect ratios. This way, users do not have to fiddle with FOV settings if they want a good experience, regardless of the monitor's aspect ratio they're using.

For example, if you were to set an horizontal compensated FOV of 90 for 4:3 aspect ratio...
- ...but you are on a 16:10 display: horizontal FOV = ~102
- ...but you are on a 16:9 display: horizontal FOV = ~107
- ...and so on...

I recall this can be more robust than setting vertical FOV (for some games at least).
